@ greenwoodae @ johndurant @ philipbstark I'm seeing a re-invented Girl Scouts who go door to door with bloody fresh meat rather than cookies
Time to pack up toys and gadgets and get back on the fucking unicycle, I guess. It's never been particularly voluntary. Never asked for it.
This explains why I've been on late shift thinking at 5am for weeks: gear shift back into high gear, and the mental reluctance to turn it up
I don't know what the hell I'm going to do but stuff is forming in my mind as it always used to, and I can't stop it 2016 to be a long year
I'm about average for my father's family, a caste of traditional Hindu academics. He's significantly brighter than me. Just how we are made.
It's time to go back to dealing with it directly rather than having it shut down and letting the unconscious mind do the work. I resist.
The material world is a tiny part of my lived experience. What's inside of my head is infinite:ideas like an occupying force. Tangible rocks
My mind is just littered with these high order interpretative frameworks which occupy my world. The physical is a small part of my sensorium
Now, the problem. This just sort of sits there in my mind like a UFO. Alongside the pandemic flu plan, database cryptography, poverty cures.
Serious alignments of interest, rather than the shit capitalist supply chain where each like of the chain fights then others for its profits
A home owner owns only a nick in the panel maker. The panel maker makes half its profits from a revenue share in your rooftop solar panels.
Now imagine a financial instrument representing ownership in the entire stack, from roof panel to silicon purifier. Weighted to your taste.
There's actually four or five other groups who should all be incentivized as the panels actually produce power. Ideal job for smart contract
The person investing in a solar panel factory and panel buyer share some common goals. Ideally both get paid when the panel produces power.
One wishes to transmit by telepathy. To show that what we see as five separate things are just points on a continuous curve. A taste...
And there's just no fucking way to linearize these things. Their native form is reified and abstract. Words are too slow, blunt instruments.
It just sort of sits there - some spatial axes like 40 years of time. Some little transhuman annotations. Some vectors, loops, interfaces.
It is fucking lonely up there. Thoughts are real things/concrete abstracts. Right now I have a six dimensional model of renewable investment
But a couple of years ago I just felt emotionally stunted. I needed a solid block of catch up time at (say) 140ish IQ rather than real 170+.
When I was a kid I learned to turn my intelligence up/down to suit the social situations I was in. I can't tell you how. Something absract.
But, actually, this blockchain stuff is worth going back into the white hell which is the synaesthetic meld of ideas: my normal mind state.
Conclusion: I've been underplaying my intellectual hand for a couple of years because I needed a "humanity break." I remember making choice

10. I sure as hell know a lot of badly behaved adults who I think could use a good spanking.
9. Cuz there is difference between parent who smacks child out of frustration, and one who ritually "lowers the boom" to make an impression.
8. As usual, I just don't like the oversimplification of what, in my own experience, is a very complex and nuanced question.
7. To extent I error, I probably error on the side of not being feared enough, and I worry about that - as a character, not a control issue.
6. I don't want my children to fear me, but I also know that the "fear" (respect) I had for my father was an important and positive thing.
5. I know one cousin who was an atrocious brat until his (incredibly gentle) parents finally spanked him, and boy he changed for the better.
4. The ritual of "spanking" was about getting my attention and establishing boundaries, when I was really out of bounds. Not hurting me.
3. I can remember a handful of occasions where my parents "spanked" me. It was more ritual than reality. They never hit to hurt, ever.
2. Hitting to hurt a child, or because you lose control, is always 100% unacceptable. Period.
1. No doubt to my everlasting regret, some thoughts on the latest spanking bruhaha.
